params._allowFailureMap: A bitmap allowing execution to succeed, even if individual actions might revert. If the bit at index `i` is 1, the execution succeeds even if the `i`th action reverts. A failure map value of 0 requires every action to not revert.
params._callId: The ID of the call. The definition of the value of `callId` is up to the calling contract and can be used, e.g., as a nonce.

returns._0: The array of results obtained from the executed actions in `bytes`.
returns._1: The resulting failure map containing the actions have actually failed.

execute(bytes32,(address,uint256,bytes)[.notice: Executes a list of actions. If a zero allow-failure map is provided, a failing action reverts the entire execution. If a non-zero allow-failure map is provided, allowed actions can fail without the entire call being reverted.
